confirm_upload_description: A database is already loaded. Do you want to overwrite it?
drag_drop_select: Drag & drop or click to select <Badge>KoboReader.sqlite</Badge> database.
error_message_notion: An error occurred while sending highlights to Notion. Please check your Page ID and API Key.

hardcover.select_book: Please select a book result first
hardcover.title: Send highlights to Hardcover
hardcover.description: Add your Hardcover API key, search for the correct book, and upload quotes.
hardcover.get_api_key: Donâ€™t have one? Get it from
hardcover.tip: Tip: To avoid duplicates on Hardcover, consider uploading after you finish a book. This app prevents re-sending from this browser but canâ€™t remove existing entries in Hardcover.

steps.1: Open your API settings on Hardcover and copy your API key.
steps.2: Paste your key into the dialog (with or without â€˜Bearerâ€™ works).
steps.3: Enter the book title and author, then click Search. Pick the correct result (cover, author, title, slug).
steps.4: Click Submit to upload the current bookâ€™s highlights or enable â€˜Send all booksâ€™ to upload everything.
steps.5: If search or upload fails due to network rules, the app automatically retries via a secure proxy.
steps.6: To minimize duplicates on Hardcover, consider uploading after you finish a book so each highlight is sent once.

help_hardcover.security: Your API key is saved only in your browserâ€™s local storage and used from the client. It is never logged, and the app strips an optional â€˜Bearerâ€™ prefix automatically.
help_hardcover.dupe_note: Tip: Upload after finishing a book to avoid duplicates. The app prevents re-sending from this browser, but Hardcover may still contain older entries.

titles.2: 2. Use Your Integration on a Page
titles.4: 4. Use the Integration in the Web App

steps.1: Follow this link to access integration page
steps.2: Click <bold>New Integration</bold>, name it, and select the workspace where it will be used.
steps.3: Copy the <bold>Internal Integration Token</bold> (secret key) and keep it safe.
steps.4: Open the Notion page you want to integrate.
steps.5: Click <bold>...</bold> button on top to open setting, click <bold>Connections</bold>, search for your integration, and select it
steps.6: Copy the last part of the URL after the last '/' (remove ?v=... if it exists).
steps.7: Enter your Integration Token and Page ID into the web app.
steps.8: Now, you can send quotes to Notion! ðŸŽ‰

section.1: KoboHighlights is a web application designed to extract and display highlights from the KoboReader.sqlite file and send them to Notion.
section.3: Display highlights in a user-friendly interface
section.5: Save highlights to local storage for offline access
section.9: You can access the source code of the project on GitHub.

localstorage_dialog_description: These highlights are loaded from your browser's local storage. They may be cleared by your browser at any time, so do not rely on their permanence. You can also manually clear them by clicking the Clear button below. Use your KoboReader.sqlite file to see the most current highlights.
not_uploaded_or_not_selected: You haven't uploaded the KoboReader.sqlite file or chosen a book title. Once the highlights are loaded, you can click them to see the action button.
send_to_notion_dialog_description: Please enter your Notion Page ID and API Key.
success_message_notion: Highlights have been sent to Notion successfully.
success_message_notion_all: All Highlights have been sent to Notion successfully.
